description: The Elmer Holmes Bobst Library, located at New York University (NYU) in Manhattan, serves as a central hub for academic research and study.
reviews: Bobst Library has been my second home throughout my time at NYU. The building itself is incredible—imagine studying under a 12-story atrium with a stunning geometric ceiling! The space is so inspiring and keeps you focused. They have endless resources, from rare books to cutting-edge research tools. And if you need a quiet spot, there are multiple silent floors where you can truly get in the zone.
Love the atmosphere.
Could use more seating.

The library is a must for anyone serious about studying. You have access to millions of books, digital resources, and archives—everything you’d ever need. That said, Bobst is popular, and sometimes it’s hard to find a good seat, especially during finals. The views from the upper floors of Washington Square Park are a big plus!
address: 70 Washington Square S, New York, NY 10012

description: The NYU Kimmel Center for University Life, located at 60 Washington Square South, is a 10-story facility on NYU’s Greenwich Village campus. It provides spaces for academic, cultural, and administrative activities, including performance venues, meeting rooms, study areas, and dining facilities. Notable features include the Eisner & Lubin Auditorium and the Rosenthal Pavilion, which host large events and conferences. The building also houses resources for student organizations and leadership programs, supporting various campus activities. Its design includes large windows offering views of Washington Square Park and the Manhattan skyline.
reviews: Love the vibe here, it's perfect for group study. Lots of seating and places to plug in your devices.
Great place to take breaks in between studying. The cafeteria is nearby, which makes it convenient.
There’s a great atmosphere here for collaboration and teamwork.
The lounge areas provide a comfortable space for casual studying and group discussions.
address: 60 Washington Square S, New York, NY 10012

description: Washington Square Park is a public park in the Greenwich Village neighborhood of Lower Manhattan, famous for its arch and vibrant social scene. It's a popular spot for both locals and tourists to relax, people-watch, and enjoy street performances.
reviews: A beautiful park, great for studying or taking a break from the city bustle. The arch is iconic and there are always interesting events happening.
A nice place to relax with friends or alone. I love how it brings people together.
It can get crowded, but it’s still one of the best places to hang out in NYC. The atmosphere is always lively and welcoming.
Perfect place to read a book or have a picnic. It’s really relaxing to just watch people and enjoy the greenery.
address: Washington Square Park, New York, NY 10012

description: The Metropolitan Museum of Art, often referred to as 'The Met', is one of the largest and most prestigious art museums in the world. Located on the eastern edge of Central Park, the museum houses an extensive collection of art from different periods and cultures.
reviews: A must-visit for any art lover! The museum has a vast collection, and the exhibits are always curated beautifully.
The Met is massive, so make sure to plan your visit well. There’s something for everyone here, from ancient history to modern art.
I always feel inspired after a visit. The museum’s atmosphere is calming, and the architecture is stunning.
It can get crowded, especially on weekends, but it’s totally worth the visit. I love the rooftop garden in the summer.

description: Brooklyn Bridge Park is a waterfront park along the East River in Brooklyn, offering stunning views of the Manhattan skyline and the Brooklyn Bridge. The park features grassy lawns, sports fields, playgrounds, and cultural events.
reviews: An amazing spot to take a walk and enjoy views of the skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. Great for outdoor activities or just relaxing by the water.
Perfect place for a picnic or to watch the sunset. It’s a beautiful park with a lot of space to explore.
I love the vibe here. The park is peaceful yet lively with people jogging, relaxing, and enjoying the scenery.
One of my favorite places in Brooklyn. I love coming here for the views and the calm atmosphere away from the city rush.

description: Central Park is a large public park in the heart of Manhattan, offering a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. It features walking paths, lakes, gardens, and iconic landmarks like Bethesda Terrace and Bow Bridge.
reviews: I love walking through Central Park in any season. It's beautiful in the fall with the changing leaves, and the summer brings so many outdoor concerts and events.
A great place to escape the city noise. It’s huge, so there’s always something new to explore.
It can get crowded, but it’s still a relaxing place to unwind, especially around the lakes or near the bridges.
Central Park is iconic for a reason. It’s not just a park, it’s an experience. Whether you’re walking, biking, or just sitting, it’s magical.
